me.aliceq.heatmap

Class HeatList

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.aliceq.heatmap.HeatList
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ReadOnlyHeatList

    public class HeatList
extends java.lang.Object
    A class containing a list of floating point values with normalized and unnormalized methods.

        Sets the value at a given index. Note that this marks the HeatList as denormalized.

        Returns:

      • normalize

        public void normalize()
        Scales all values in the HeatList so that their collective sum equals 1.

      • verifyNormalization

        public boolean verifyNormalization()
        Flags the HeatList as normalized if the sum of its values equals 1.0f or 0f (+/-.00001f)
        Returns:
        true if the List is normalized, false otherwise

      • equalize

        public float equalize()
        Equalizes and normalizes all values in the HeatList
        Returns:
        the equalized value

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets all values in the map to zero

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears all values and samples in the map

      • empty

        public boolean empty()
        Checks whether or not a HeatList is empty
        Returns:
        false if the sample size is less than 1

      • normalized

        public boolean normalized()
        Verifies that the list is normalized
        Returns:
        true when normalized, otherwise false

      • markDirty

        public void markDirty()
        Marks a HeatList as denormalized

      • addNewIndex

        public void addNewIndex(int index)
        Creates a new value initialized to 0. Values to the right of the index get shifted right.
        Parameters:
        index - the index to push a zero into

      • discardIndex

        public float discardIndex(int index)
        Deletes an index from the list. Note that this method is unsafe and risks de-normalizing the list.
        Parameters:
        index - The index to delete
        Returns:
        The removed value

      • deleteIndex

        public float deleteIndex(int index)
        Deletes an index from the list without affecting normalization
        Parameters:
        index - The index to delete
        Returns:
        The removed value

      • overwriteValue

        public float overwriteValue(int index,
                   float value)
        Overwrites a value in the list. Note that this may denormalize the map, so it is recommended to re-normalize after overwrites are done.
        Parameters:
        index - the index to modify
        value - the new value
        Returns:
        the old value at the index

      • average

        public static HeatList average(HeatList a,
               HeatList b)
        Merges two heatlists together. The resulting values are the average of the two and the resulting sample count is the sum of the two. The result is normalized if both input lists are normalized. If the lists are of different sizes an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        a - The first heatlist
        b - The second heatlist
        Returns:
        The average of two Heatlists

      • average

        public static HeatList average(HeatList[] lists)
        Merges multiple heatlists together. The resulting values are the average of all the lists and the resulting sample count is their sum. The result is normalized if all input lists are normalized. If the lists are of different sizes an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        lists -
        Returns:

      • interpolate

        public static HeatList interpolate(HeatList a,
                   HeatList b,
                   float value)
        Interpolates between two Heatlists. The resulting values are interpolated between both lists and the resulting sample count is the sum of the two.The result is normalized if both input lists are normalized. If the lists are of different sizes an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        a -
        b -
        value - The interpolation value. A value of 0 returns HeatList a and a value of 1 returns HeatList b.
        Returns:
        a HeatList whose values are the average of two other's

      • getCumulative

        public static HeatList getCumulative(HeatList source)
        Creates a cumulative-sum HeatList from a source list.
        Parameters:
        source - the source list
        Returns:
        a new HeatList
